intro: Chromolaena bahamensis, commonly known as Bahamian chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow and clustered in dense inflorescences. Chromolaena bahamensis is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
